verses.kjv: In those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea,
verses.ct: During that time, John the Baptist appeared in the Judean wilderness, proclaiming his message.

verses.kjv: And saying, Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
verses.ct: He declared, "Turn away from your sins, because the kingdom of heaven is near!"

verses.kjv: For this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Esaias, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
verses.ct: John was the one the prophet Isaiah spoke about when he wrote: "A voice calling out in the wilderness: Get the road ready for the Lord, straighten out the paths for him."

verses.kjv: And the same John had his raiment of camel’s hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins; and his meat was locusts and wild honey.
verses.ct: John wore clothing made from camel's hair with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.

verses.kjv: Then went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judaea, and all the region round about Jordan,
verses.ct: People came out to see him from Jerusalem, from all across Judea, and from the entire area surrounding the Jordan River.

verses.kjv: And were baptized of him in Jordan, confessing their sins.
verses.ct: They openly admitted their sins and were baptized by him in the Jordan River.

verses.kjv: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.ct: But when he noticed many Pharisees and Sadducees showing up for baptism, he told them, "You nest of snakes! Who tipped you off to run from the coming judgment?"

verses.kjv: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:
verses.ct: "Prove that you've genuinely changed by the way you live."

verses.kjv: And think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
verses.ct: "Don't convince yourselves that you're safe because Abraham is your ancestor. I'm telling you, God could turn these stones into descendants of Abraham."

verses.kjv: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
verses.ct: "The axe is already positioned at the base of the trees. Every tree that doesn't produce good fruit will be chopped down and thrown into the fire."

verses.kjv: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost, and with fire:
verses.ct: "I baptize you with water as a sign of turning from sin, but the one coming after me is far more powerful than I am. I'm not even worthy to carry his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire."

verses.kjv: Whose fan is in his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and gather his wheat into the garner; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.
verses.ct: "He has his winnowing fork ready, and he will thoroughly clean out his threshing floor. He'll collect his wheat into the storehouse, but the worthless husks he'll burn in a fire that never goes out."

verses.kjv: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John, to be baptized of him.
verses.ct: Then Jesus arrived from Galilee at the Jordan River, coming to John to be baptized by him.

verses.kjv: But John forbad him, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?
verses.ct: John tried to stop him, saying, "I'm the one who needs to be baptized by you — why are you coming to me?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said unto him, Suffer it to be so now: for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness. Then he suffered him.
verses.ct: But Jesus replied, "Allow it for now. This is how we should fulfill all righteousness." So John agreed.

verses.kjv: And Jesus, when he was baptized, went up straightway out of the water: and, lo, the heavens were opened unto him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and lighting upon him:
verses.ct: As soon as Jesus was baptized, he came up out of the water. At that moment the heavens opened, and he saw the Spirit of God coming down like a dove and resting on him.

verses.kjv: And lo a voice from heaven, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
verses.ct: Then a voice spoke from heaven: "This is my Son, whom I dearly love. I am completely pleased with him."
